column2: Having converted to the Confucian religion, I must now choose one of the schools to adhere to. The Traditionalists embrace the more spiritual influences of Taoism and Buddhism, while the Neo-Confucians call for the rejection of mysticism.
Confucius himself spoke of the will of mystical Tian.
The only way to understand the world is reason.
The schools of Confucianism are not rigid and absolute. I am disillusioned with my current school and therefore wish to adopt and sponsor a different branch of Confucian philosophy.
Diplomatic Insight
This character has interpreted their holy texts to gain insight into the workings of interpersonal relations and diplomacy.
Martial Insight
This character has interpreted their holy texts to gain insight into the workings of strategy and the art of commanding an army.
Steward's Insight
This character has interpreted their holy texts to gain insight into the workings of finance and administration.
Intriguing Insight
This character has interpreted their holy texts to gain insight into the workings of subterfuge and seduction.
Learning Insight
This character has interpreted their holy texts to gain insight into the workings of their faith and the world around them.

There are so many words in the ancient texts about every aspect of managing a realm, from diplomacy to military management to economics. I simply need to choose one of them to focus on, so that I can fully extract the meaning of the texts and better my skills in that field.
I need to improve my diplomacy.
Commanding and managing an army sounds important.
Without good administration, nothing else matters.
I am looking for something more personal.

The ancient texts certainly do not lack advice on the personal, whether it is deceit, subterfuge, seduction or simply focusing on improving one's knowledge. Once again, I must choose one of them to study.
I will learn deceit and seduction.
I want to know about the world around me.
On second thoughts, maybe realm management?
It is all too complicated, the ancients are wise.

If I wish to dedicate myself to Taoism, I should also choose one of its major schools to align myself with. Each school has a slightly different set of practices and structure, and although there is little animosity between schools selecting the correct one to guide me on my path to immortality is still important.
The orthodox ways of the Zhengyi Dao are the best.
I find the focus on inner perfection by the Quanzhen School appealing.
The Shangqing School's meditation practices shall lead me to clarity.

While I currently sponsor and follow the practices of a particular school of Taoism, there is little shame in considering other approaches. I wish to declare my alignment with a different school of Taoism from the one which I currently follow.
